intro: Octomeria peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian octomeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at high altitudes. Octomeria peruviana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
